it.unibo.alchemist.model.interfaces

Interface IEnvironment<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type which describes the concentration of a molecule Interface for an environment. Every environment must implement this specification.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Iterable<INode<T>>, Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IEnvironment2DWithObstacles<W,T>, IMapEnvironment<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEnvironment, AbstractLinkingRuleEnvironment, Continuous2DEnvironment, Continuous2DObstacles, DiscreteStaticGrid2DManhattan, ImageEnvironment, InfiniteHalls, LimitedContinuos2D, MuseumHall, OSMEnvironment

    public interface IEnvironment<T>
extends Serializable, Iterable<INode<T>>

    • Method Detail

      • addNode

        void addNode(INode<T> node,
             IPosition p)
        This method allows to add a new node to this environment. The environment is responsible to call the right method of the simulation in order to ensure that the reaction is properly scheduled.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to add
        p - The position where to place it

      • getDimensions

        int getDimensions()
        The number of dimensions of this environment.
        Returns:
        the number of dimensions of this environment

      • getDistanceBetweenNodes

        double getDistanceBetweenNodes(INode<T> n1,
                               INode<T> n2)
        Measures the distance between two nodes in the environment.
        Parameters:
        n1 - the first node
        n2 - the second node
        Returns:
        the distance between the two nodes

      • getNeighborhood

        INeighborhood<T> getNeighborhood(INode<T> center)
        Given a node, this method returns its neighborhood.
        Parameters:
        center - The node you want the neighbors to be found
        Returns:
        the neighborhood

      • getNodeByID

        INode<T> getNodeByID(int id)
        Allows to access a node known its id.
        Parameters:
        id - the node's ID
        Returns:
        the node with that id, or null if it does not exist in this environment

      • getNodes

        Collection<? extends INode<T>> getNodes()
        All the nodes that exist in current environment.
        Returns:
        All the nodes that exist in current environment

      • getNodesNumber

        int getNodesNumber()
        Returns:
        the number of nodes currently in the environment

      • getNodesWithinRange

        Collection<INode<T>> getNodesWithinRange(INode<T> center,
                                         double range)
        Given a node (center) this method returns a list of all the surroundings nodes within the given range. Note that this method (depending on the implementation) might be not optimized and it's consequently much better to use getNeighborhood(INode) and filter the neighborhood if you are sure that all the nodes within the range are connected to the center.
        Parameters:
        center - the node to consider as center
        range - the exploration range
        Returns:
        the list of nodes within the range

      • getNodesWithinRange

        Collection<INode<T>> getNodesWithinRange(IPosition center,
                                         double range)
        Given a IPosition(center) this method returns a list of all the surroundings nodes within the given range. Note that this method (depending on the implementation) might be not optimized.
        Parameters:
        center - the IPosition to consider as center
        range - the exploration range
        Returns:
        the list of nodes within the range

      • getOffset

        double[] getOffset()
        This method allows to know which are the smallest coordinates represented.
        Returns:
        an array of length getDimensions() containing the smallest coordinates for each dimension.

      • getPosition

        IPosition getPosition(INode<T> node)
        Calculates the position of a node.
        Parameters:
        node - the node you want to know the position
        Returns:
        The position

      • getPreferredMonitor

        String getPreferredMonitor()
        Returns:
        the class name of the monitor that should preferably used for displaying the contents of this environment. Full class names are recommended: it's up to the graphical interface to decide how to deal with simple class names (whether or not to prefix a standard package). In case of null return or inexistent class, the default monitor will be used.

      • getSize

        double[] getSize()
        This method returns the size of the environment as an array of length getDimensions.
        Returns:
        the size of this environment

      • moveNode

        void moveNode(INode<T> node,
              IPosition direction)
        This method moves a node in the environment toward some direction. If node move is unsupported, it does nothing.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to move
        direction - The position which will be summed to the current position to move the node in the right place.

      • moveNodeToPosition

        void moveNodeToPosition(INode<T> node,
                        IPosition position)
        This method moves a node in the environment to some position. If node move is unsupported, it does nothing.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to move
        position - The absolute position in which this node will be moved.

      • removeNode

        void removeNode(INode<T> node)
        This method allows to remove a node. If node removal is unsupported, it does nothing.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to remove

      • setLinkingRule

        void setLinkingRule(ILinkingRule<T> rule)
        Parameters:
        rule - the rule to set

      • getLinkingRule

        ILinkingRule<T> getLinkingRule()
        Returns:
        the current linking rule
